intro: Eriocaulon ramnadense, commonly known as the Ramnad sedge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, spike-like flowers. It typically thrives in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
